image.altText: A piece of wood with dark trails inside.

props.synopsis: It's smaller than a sesame seed, but the shot-hole borer has made short work of some of Perth's most iconic trees. Now other states and territories are being warned to take action to avoid a similar fate.

title.children: WA loses the war on shot-hole borer — can the rest of Australia be saved?

image.altText: Australian road sign of a kangaroo in central Australia

props.synopsis: A WA government department says the state’s new firearms laws are causing headaches for a program which responds to reports of injured and suffering animals on the roadside.

title.children: Why WA’s gun law reforms are causing problems for wildlife officers

image.altText: A man in a black shirt looks at the camera while standing out the front of a house

props.synopsis: Indigenous mental health worker Bill Ring says Kalgoorlie's housing shortage and a lack of support from the WA Country Health Service have left him struggling to find a permanent home.

title.children: Housing crisis leaves health worker on verge of homelessness

image.altText: A small fish in the water.

props.synopsis: A species more than 360 million years old is spotted migrating up Margaret River in the state's South West after record winter rains.

title.children: Rare sight as vampiric fish spotted swimming up WA river

image.altText: Roger Cook, wearing a blue shirt, chats with an fishermen and baits a hook on a jetty.

props.synopsis: Recreational fishers and commercial guides fear being locked out of some of Western Australia's most pristine waters under plans to protect the globally significant Exmouth Gulf.

title.children: Fishers left reeling by Exmouth Gulf Marine Park announcement

image.altText: Premier Roger Cook speaks to reporters in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: Concerns about a controversial plan to build a racetrack in the middle of Burswood are acknowledged by the WA premier, alongside a concession he got it wrong when he opposed the construction of the now beloved Perth Stadium.

title.children: Premier admits he was wrong to oppose Perth Stadium in defending racetrack

image.altText: A composite image of Brittany Higgins and Linda Reynolds.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins has been ordered to pay the lion's share of her former boss Linda Reynolds's legal expenses in the blockbuster defamation trial that concluded last month.

title.children: Brittany Higgins ordered to pay Reynolds's court costs, amount will exceed $1 million

image.altText: The side of Perth Children's Hospital, with a sign showing the building's name.

props.synopsis: High levels of lead detected in the water at Perth Children's Hospital do not pose a risk to patient safety, health authorities say.

title.children: Lead in water at Perth Children's Hospital 'no risk' to safety, says health minister

image.altText: A forensic scene at a campground. A swag and police cars can be seen.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old is in a serious but stable condition after being run over at a rodeo in Western Australia's Pilbara region.

title.children: Young man run over while sleeping in swag at rodeo

image.altText: A middle-aged man with short, grey hair wears a dark suit and sunglasses while standing outside a court building.

props.synopsis: Stewart Patrick Burchell is accused of committing the offences, including the rape of a staff member, over the course of six years.

title.children: Former Broome pub manager faces trial on 16 sexual assault charges

image.altText: A small dinghy approaches a large fishing boat

props.synopsis: The Australian Border Force is launching a reporting function on a popular fishing app, but stakeholders in the far north say the technology means little without more boots on the ground.

title.children: Border Force turns to popular app to help fight illegal fishing

image.altText: A man smiles while speaking in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: Perth man Dion Barber, who was repeatedly sexually abused at successive state care placements, is awarded almost $3 million in compensation by a judge.

title.children: Perth man awarded almost $3 million for sexual abuse in state care

image.altText: A young man and an older man sit together in sporting stands

props.synopsis: Rupert Murdoch's family has always been close. But if you really want to trace the extent of filial and sibling affection, you need to follow the money.

title.children: Lachlan emerges as winner but Murdoch hold on News and Fox more vulnerable

image.altText: Donald Trump sitting at a desk in the Oval Office holding a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians living in the US could find it tougher to extend their stay in America after the Trump administration suddenly issued new visa rules on the weekend.

title.children: Australians' visas denied after Trump administration suddenly changes rule

image.altText: A row of solar panels are stood in the ground above red dirt

props.synopsis: BHP dumps plans for major renewable energy projects in WA's Pilbara, prompting concern the miner is backing away from emissions reduction goals.

title.children: BHP dumps solar, battery projects that promised to cut emissions

image.altText: A camera on a highway

props.synopsis: AI-enabled sentry hives will soon line the main route to Western Australia from South Australia, using cameras and 4G to detect varroa mite.

title.children: Varroa mite reaches another state, but WA has upped its game

image.altText: A child's hands play with nylon strings on an acoustic guitar

props.synopsis: Music and art therapists will be able to bill NDIS participants at the same rate as counsellors after a review found the therapies could be effective in the right circumstances.

title.children: NDIS call made on music and art therapy after review of evidence base

image.altText: A drone shot over Dempster Head in Esperance, with the ocean and town in the background

props.synopsis: Renowned for some of the best beaches in the country, Esperance also holds the unenviable position as the second-tightest rental market in regional Australia.

title.children: Lack of housing having 'domino effect' in popular WA tourist town

image.altText: A teen girl with hair over her faces looks down at the ground in a dimly lit street.

props.synopsis: After her daughter's school suggested her 9-year-old find a "secret" way to tell her teacher she was being bullied, one parent has demanded change.

title.children: Parents demand change as 9yo told to 'not be so much of a target' for bullies

image.altText: NAB bank signage in red, black and white colours

props.synopsis: NAB is the latest bank to announce job significant cuts, while Wall Street's fresh record highs are unlikely to drive Australian share market much higher and an interest rate cut in the US this month is looking increasingly certain after some worse than expected job figures. See how the trading day unfolds on our blog.

title.children: NAB to slash 410 jobs and hire more workers overseas

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why are ASX lithium stocks being sold off?
Mining and lithium sell-off weighs on ASX
Lacklustre start to ASX trading day

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens

props.synopsis: A new information resource for Australians travelling abroad will be launched today, a move inspired by the deaths of teenagers Holly Bowles and Bianca Jones due to methanol poisoning in Laos last year. Follow live.

title.children: Government launches 'Partying Safely Hub' for young Australian travellers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Richard Marles announces $1.7 billion for 'stealth' ghost shark submarines
Wong 'frustrated' by Laos investigation into deaths of two Melbourne teens
Vanuatu trip still had purpose despite no deal signed: Labor

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou rubs his chin

props.synopsis: Australian's Ange Postecolgou has been named as new head coach of Premier League side Nottingham Forest after the sacking of Nuno Espírito Santo.

title.children: Postecoglou makes Premier League return with Nottingham Forest

image.altText: Front entrance of a building marked "Hoffman Engineering"

props.synopsis: A 45-year-old man is dead after a workplace incident at Hofmann Engineering in Bassendean, just a year after the company was fined $500,000 over a fatal accident in 2019.

title.children: Worker's 'tragic death' comes six years after fatality at same workshop

image.altText: A closeup of a ready-to-be-harvested medicinal cannabis plant.

props.synopsis: Despite more than 600 reports of "adverse events" for medicinal cannabis in the past three years, the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA) is yet to investigate the safety of most medicinal cannabis products. It has now launched a review.

title.children: Psychiatrists fear medicinal cannabis adverse events are 'tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: Simon Tyler headshot

props.synopsis: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

title.children: There is a high rate of suicide in construction. Here's what to look for

image.altText: A Socceroos forward grins while carrying a teammate on his back, celebrating a goal.

props.synopsis: Mohamed Toure and Nestory Irankunda dazzle after being handed a rare opportunity to start under Tony Popovic as the Socceroos retain the 'Soccer Ashes' with a commanding win over New Zealand in Auckland.

title.children: Irankunda and Toure give Socceroos a World Cup headache after dazzling against NZ

image.altText: Pat Cummins licks his lips

props.synopsis: Pat Cummins is adamant there are no depth issues around Australia's bowling ahead of the Ashes, at a time when England are building back towards full strength.

title.children: Cummins hails bowling depth despite injury concerns

image.altText: Jai Hindley smiles in front of a red background

props.synopsis: Jai Hindley is in prime position to land his third career cycling grand tour podium ahead of a crucial last week at the Vuelta a España — and he is still contemplating overall victory.

title.children: 'Super motivated' West Aussie Hindley eyes Vuelta glory entering final week

image.altText: Premier Roger Cook wearing a suit and tie delivers a speech at a lectern.

props.synopsis: New legislation aimed at fast-tracking priority energy and defence projects in Western Australia could put the environment at risk and lead to less transparent government, experts say.

title.children: Experts warn of danger in new WA fast-track development approvals

image.altText: Mid shot of Madeleine Kind wearing a white blazer talking in front of media microphones

props.synopsis: Federal Resources Minister Madeleine King backs the WA government's controversial Burswood racetrack plan, after her Labor colleague Patrick Gorman slammed the idea.

title.children: Labor divisions grow over Burswood racetrack, with two federal MPs at odds

image.altText: Rob Wignalls leans against his home behind warning tape.

props.synopsis: A long-time winemaker says he opened his door to explosions and a black ball of smoke as a fire caused by a cordless screwdriver destroyed a lifetime collection of tools and machinery.

title.children: Winemaker shares devastation after lithium battery fire guts warehouse

image.altText: Man in blue suit jacket with black Labrador dog

props.synopsis: A vision-impaired Paralympic swimmer says he had to involve police when three different Uber drivers refused him transport because he had his guide dog with him.

title.children: Police called after Uber drivers refused service to Paralympian with guide dog

image.altText: A WA police officer stands with his back to the camera looking at two trucks

props.synopsis: A WA judge finds police acted unlawfully in detaining a man in July 2023, leading to him being allowed to go free despite being found to be in possession of methylamphetamine.

title.children: Botched police search lets man found with packages of drugs walk free
